item.title: By: Paul Shaviv

item.description:
Any of them are welcome at Ramaz!
Fascinating, and I agree with 'Baruch'.
item.content:encoded:
Any of them are welcome at Ramaz!

Fascinating, and I agree with ‘Baruch’.

item.title: By: Baruch
item.dc:creator: Baruch
item.description: This is possibly the most useful and insightful post for the so-called 'Tefillin Controversy' in all of cyberspace thus far.
item.content:encoded: This is possibly the most useful and insightful post for the so-called ‘Tefillin Controversy’ in all of cyberspace thus far.

item.title: By: Shoshana Razel
item.dc:creator: Shoshana Razel
item.description: This is just the thing that excites me about my dharmasastric research in recent years. Two years ago--when my Sanskrit pronunciation was terrible--I wrote a paper titled: "Can a woman be a Sista," thinking that this was a great pun. Only problem is that Sista--or good-man-whose-practice-is-worthy-of-emulation--is pronounces SHISHTA and not SISTA. Sooooo… awkward… No pun after all…
item.content:encoded: This is just the thing that excites me about my dharmasastric research in recent years. Two years ago–when my Sanskrit pronunciation was terrible–I wrote a paper titled: “Can a woman be a Sista,” thinking that this was a great pun. Only problem is that Sista–or good-man-whose-practice-is-worthy-of-emulation–is pronounces SHISHTA and not SISTA. Sooooo… awkward… No pun after all…
